The site celebrates a subversive "trolling culture",  and documents underground internet events such as mass organized pranks (trolling events termed "raids"), large scale failures of internet infrastructure and security, and criticism of conservative internet communities accused of self-censorship in order to garner prestige or positive coverage from traditional and established media outlets. The magazine ''Wired'' described the site as "where the vast parallel universe of ''Anonymous'' in-jokes, catchphrases, and obsessions is lovingly annotated, and you will discover an elaborate trolling culture: Flamingly racist and misogynist content lurks throughout, all of it calculated to offend".
